title: Electric flux - cubical surface in a uniform field

content.question: A Gaussian surface, in the shape of a cube of side length <math alttext="lowercase a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>, is oriented with one corner at the origin <math alttext="O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>O</mi></math>, as shown in the figure. The cubical surface is in a region with charges (not shown) where the resulting electric field is described by <math alttext="vector E, equals open parenthesis, b x, close parenthesis, i hat" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>E</mi><mo>â†’</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></math>, where <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> is a positive constant. What is the total electric flux through the surface of the cube?

choices.label: <math alttext="b times lowercase a cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="2 b times lowercase a cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="6 b times lowercase a cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="b times lowercase a cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
